conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for the Northern Negotiators event.
E-everyone here looks so...fancy. It's just how I'd imagined a royal banquet would be!
Say, Joachim? What do you do at events like this? It's my first time, and I don't know what any of the rules...
...are. Er, Joachim?
Oh, that? It was nothing.
Such modesty—yet you managed to sweet- talk Chelle, of all people. Tell me, lad, what WAS your trick? I must know!
Sorry, friend. That's classified.
Oh, there he is! Joachi—
Oof! Oh, I beg your pardon, madam!
N-no...it was my fault.
Joachim? Oh, drat. I lost him again.
Aw jeez... J-Joachiiim? Where are you?
H-huh? How did I end up out here?
Julia, my turtledove! At long last!
Oh, Remuel! How I've burned to see you!
(Eeep! Oh gosh, is this a lover's tryst? I mean, I've read about them in romance novels, but never actually...seen one.)
(They're clearly nobles based on how they're dressed, so I guess they snuck out of the banquet?)
You don't know how I've pined for this day to come, my sweet. I knew we were both slated to attend tonight's banquet, and here we are together at last!
Ah, but I do know—for I have pined for it just as long! Oh, WHY must our fathers persist in their silly grudge?! Why must our families hate each other so?!
If they would only accept our union, we could spend every night locked in each other's arms!
(I guess their families don't like them being together, which explains the secret meeting.)
(Oh gosh, Noelle, stop spying on them! ...Good luck, you two! I hope everything works out!)
(Eeep! Someone ELSE is coming! Better stay hidden right here...)
There you are, Julia my dear! I've been searching high and low for...
Fie, but I know the man with you! He's the son of that detestable snake!
I don't care WHOSE son he is! Remuel and I are in LOVE!
Poppycock! I won't hear another word of it! No daughter of mine will consort with the spawn of that viper! Now come.
F-Father, please! Wait!
Remuel! Remuel, my love!
Julia, no! Juliaaa!
So THIS is where you've gotten off to, Remuel. Goodness, what is all of this absurd shouting abou...
I say, what are you doing with this slavering hyena and his cur daughter?!
Better a hyena than a pathetic carrion jackal such as yourself!
HARUMPH!
I'm suddenly overtaken with a wave of nausea. Julia, come along this instant!
For once, we're in agreement. Remuel!
My love...
Whoa... That was crazy!
Huh? What's that?
Some kind of brooch? That poor woman must have dropped it.
I should get it back to her. She's probably over in that building where her father dragged her off to...
Found her! Um, m-ma'am? Excuse me, ma'am?
Hm? Can I help you with something?
BROOCH! Er, I mean, um...this is yours here please take it I'm really sorry!
Goodness, it IS mine! Thank you so much. Where in the world did I drop it?
O-outside... It probably fell off after you were, um...dragged away.
So...you saw that, did you?
*gulp* Um...sorry?
It wasn't my intention to blame you; though I would consider it a great kindness if you kept the matter to yourself.
*nod*
I appreciate it, Miss... Hmm. I don't think we've actually met.
I know most every face in Chanzelia, yet I've never seen yours before. Are you a visitor from elsewhere?
Y-yes, ma'am. My name is Noelle, and I... I'm part of the diplomatic contingent from Svenitla.
You're with that military from up north? Oh, I've heard some wonderful tales of your brave exploits!
Impressive work recently, by the way: Securing a deal out of Chelle is no mean feat.
Oh, J-Joachim is the impressive one. He, um...did all the important stuff.
All I did was run around and deliver orders. S-same as always, really...
But don't high-ranking officers usually give orders? Forgive me if I'm overstepping; I'm largely ignorant of military affairs.
Oh, I don't come up with the orders! I'm just a messenger. My job is to deliver letters without being caught, basically.
Well, that sounds very important indeed. And also very brave, to be sneaking past an enemy to deliver...
Ah! I am struck with a flash of inspiration!
Let's continue this conversation outside, shall we? It wouldn't do to be overheard.
Um...all right?
We should have a bit of privacy here.
Noelle, I need your help to deliver this love letter to my beloved Remuel.
A l-l-love letter?!
Yes. Seeing as how you're an expert in delivering letters in secret, I trust you can find a way to secure this into his care?
You saw for yourself earlier how our fathers' inane feud is standing in the way of our true love.
If we can't meet in person, then I must at least share the contents of my heart with him by way of the pen!
That...sounds nice...
A-all right! I'll make sure your feelings reach him one way or the other!
Connecting one person to another is a messenger's job, after all!
I accepted the job of delivering this letter to Remuel, but maybe I should've thought things through a little more first...?
Sneaking into a manor I haven't been invited to isn't the best look for a member of a diplomatic mission...
If I get caught, it'll be really, REALLY bad. But still...
Remuel! Remuel, my love!
Julia, no! Juliaaa!
In a fair world, those star-crossed lovers would be connected...so I can't let this sad ending stand!
I have to get this message through... I have to see Julia's letter delivered!
*sneeeak*
(I'll need to think of this as a battlefield— and if the front lines are full of enemies, I'll need to move quickly and carefully.)
(First, I need to observe the situation. I can take cover there and...)
(Eeep!)
Phew!
(You've got this, Noelle... Keep calm, keep cool, and keep moving!)
*sigh* Oh, my Julia...
Hmm? Who's there?
Er, I have a message. From Julia. Can you, um...open the door?
From Julia?! Can it be true?!
*nod* This letter is...um... Here.
This is sealed with her family crest!
Hmm, yes... Yes, I see...
Oh, my sweet Julia! My heart sings to see your feelings writ large across the page!
I shall pen my response immediately. Pray tarry a moment, good messenger.
S-sure. No problem.
(Yay! It looks like the letter is doing its job to connect the two of them.)
...Hup!
Er, thank you, Julia. Hanging that rope out of your window made it a lot easier for me to get into your room.
Here, this is... This is Remuel's reply. To your letter, I mean.
You're sent by the Goddess herself, Noelle. Thank you.
Now let me see...
Oh, happy day! He accepts!
Um...accepts? Accepts what?
We're going to elope!
WHAT?!
If we stay in these awful houses, we'll never be together—so if loving him means leaving everything behind, that's what I'm ready to do!
I told him exactly how I felt in the letter, and he feels exactly the same!
Oh, I don't know how I'll ever repay you.
Um... Y-yeah, that's... *gulp*
Goodness, things are about to get busy; I need to discuss the details of our plan with Remuel.
Your help is going to be more vital than ever in the coming days, Noelle!
Oh, um, right. That's... Sure.
(They certainly managed to connect, but...now they're eloping?)
(Does that count as a happy ending?)
...So now you've come to me for advice.
*nod* D-do you really think they should, um...elope?
If that's what the two of 'em want, who am I to say otherwise?
You only get one thing from sticking your nose into other folks' romances: trouble.
You...really think so?
Yup. And with THAT squared away...
Noelle, don't you think invading a noble's manor is a little over the top? Or a LOT? One wrong step, and we've got a diplomatic crisis on our hands.
Urk! I'm s-sorry...
I know it's wrong. I knew it while I was doing it. But I just... Um...
You felt there was justification for going over the top like that?
...Yes.
Well, now that you've pulled off your crazy stunt and gotten dragged even deeper into it, do you regret anything?
Any thoughts about how maybe you shouldn't have gotten involved?
N-no! I don't think that at all!
Didn't think so. So what makes you think the two of them feel any different?
Wh-what do you mean?
I don't see them regretting their decision, no matter what happens after they elope.
They have a reason to shoot for the moon, so they'll find a way to live with the result.
Ah!
I expect they'll still be thankful for your helping them, too.
Nobody can say whether the future holds happiness or sorrow.
But I'm pretty sure a present where two people in love can't be with one another is likely to be the latter.
That's why you agreed to help, right?
*nod* R-right!
Thank you, Joachim. I feel like the knot in my chest is...gone.
I want to help Julia and Remuel stay connected for good!
I want to change their unhappy present!
Sounds like you've got your answer, then.
Just try to wrap this up quick, yeah? We're supposed to head back soon.
Oh, and try not to start any wars.
Eep! O-okay. I'll be careful...
Meanwhile, in Julia's manor...
Okay, I've got clothes, food, and money. That's all a girl needs to elope, right?
Oh! I almost forgot Remuel's letter!
I would never forgive myself if I left his beautiful words behind.
I'll treasure this all my life, for it is the precious seed from which our happy future is sure to grow!
Heh. I really do owe Noelle a huge debt for all she's—
Julia, my dear, I wanted to speak with you about the upcoming—
F-Father!
Hmm? What did you put behind your back?
I, um...don't know what you mean?
And why is your bag packed? I don't remember you having a trip planned.
What, this? Noooo, this isn't my bag! It's...um...
You are acting very strange, child. Just what are you...?
Eek!
Show me what you're hiding this instant!
No! Don't!
A letter? What in blazes is...?
...Remuel?! Love?! ELOPEMENT?! Explain this letter at once!
I'm sorry, Father, but I love him! I do!
I am aware that you believe as much. However, I am more curious how a letter from that dog found its way in here!
Was it the butler? Did you enlist a maid? By Ilia, I'll have the entire staff sacked before the sun crosses the horizon!
STOP! It wasn't anyone from the manor!
An outsider, then.
N-no! Listen to me, Father, there isn't—
Stay your words, girl! I'm doubling the guard at your door—no, TRIPLING it! By the time I'm done, not even AIR will be able to get in here without my say-so!
What have I done? How will Remuel and I ever be together now?
Oh, and poor Noelle! When she comes back with Remuel's reply, she'll be caught red-handed for sure!
Julia's manor, the following day...
Um, there's no rope? She usually hangs it out of her window for me, so...
Has something happened?
Ah! S-someone's coming! I have to hide!
Ummm... Uhhh... There! Shrubs!
Huh? Thought I saw someone just now.
I bet it's that cad who's carrying letters to trick the young miss into marriage!
(Th-they know about the elopement! ...And about ME!)
(Guess that explains all the security.)
Might still be lurking in the shadows... Oy! Over here! I need backup!
Ho there! Did you find our man?!
I saw a shadow moving this way, but then I lost it. Here, help me beat the bushes.
(Oooh, this is bad... If I stay here, I'm as good as caught.)
(But if they know about the elopement, there's no point in delivering this letter anyway. I have to run.)
(Still...)
My future with Julia rests in your hands!
(...No. It's not up to me to decide if there's a point to making a delivery or not.)
(Only its recipient can make that call... which means I must get it to Julia.)
(There's no other choice!)
(Okay... Let me see if I can find a rock around here... Ah! There we are.)
Hey! Did you hear that?!
*sneeeak*
(Whew! I made it into the manor.)
(Oh, but security is just as tight in here!)
(Okay, Noelle. Be calm... Be careful... Watch their movements closely...)
(My hiding spots are...there. And there.)
(Aaand...now! The coast is clear!)
Very good. Next, I must attend to the...
Eep!
Hrm? Did something just...?
...Goodness! The master is calling! And to think I nearly missed it, my word.
*CRASH!* Oh no! I knocked something over!
What do I do, what do I DOOO?! If anyone heard that, I'm...
Whew! Okay, I think I'm safe.
Er, but what is this room? I just jumped in here when I saw it was empty, but...
I think it might be a storage closet. There's lots of random... Huh? What's this?
Oh, there's a letter inside! Looks old...
Wh-what?! Am I reading this right?!
B-but if this is... No, it has to be!
If this works, it could solve everything! Julia and Remuel could meet out in the open whenever they wanted!
Hm? Is someone in here?
Eep!
Is someone in here?
Eep! I have to hide!
Noelle? Is that you?
Um...h-how do you know my name?
It IS you! Oh, thank heavens no one else found you first.
J-Julia?!
I must apologize for the increased security. Things have been a bit—
Th-they know! About the plan to elope, I mean. I...heard a guard outside talking about it earlier.
But if you knew, why did you come inside? There's no point in trading letters when the plan has already been found out!
That wasn't for me to decide; this letter belongs to you.
Anyway, um...here. It's from Remuel.
You really are something else.
But thank you. Letter received.
...Oh, I can almost see his smile as I read his words. He always was a hopeful fool.
But now our future will never be, and it's all my fault.
I don't even know how to tell him...
Th-that's okay! I'll write him back!
I've actually come up with a plan.
A...plan?
*nod* And if it works, you and Remuel should be able to meet up! ...Um, in the open, I mean. Whenever you want.
How is such a thing possible?!
With this!
It's a whole bunch of old letters I found— letters between your dad and Remuel's.
THOSE two wrote each other letters?! It staggers the imagination.
Y-yeah, and it seems like they used to be really close before something came between them...
So if, um... If we can fix that, we might be able to stop this whole feud thing!
At which point, they would have no reason to oppose our relationship...
Oh, this is wonderful. If it really works, it would change EVERYTHING!
But how do we go about doing that, exactly? They pretty much hate each other.
Reading their correspondence, I, um... noticed something: There was no reason for them to have fought in the first place.
I think it was all just a misunderstanding.
The next day, at the ball...
Father, you have a guest waiting in the drawing room. It seems they have a sensitive matter to discuss?
Very well. Lead on.
Of course. Right this way...
Wha—?! YOU!
What are YOU doing here?!
Um...I set it up. I asked Julia and Remuel to bring you here.
I, um... I just needed to find out what made a pair of old friends drift apart when they used to be...pen pals.
So you know of the letters, eh? How?!
I...read them. In a storage closet.
YOU! YOU are the rat who's been breaking into my home to deliver those damnable missives to my daughter!
You are nothing but a base criminal, and I will see you hanged for this!
Father, stop! Just LISTEN to her!
This feud you're clinging to all may have started as a simple misunderstanding!
Pfft! Nonsense.
This letter here is, um... from Remuel's father.
See how there's a page missing?
I'm a m-messenger, so I always make sure to count the pages in a letter. It's...part of the job.
'Cause, um, I don't want it to be out of order or...something.
I suppose I don't pay overmuch attention to such things when reading my mail.
But even so, a fellow can tell when a PAGE is missing! It would leave a jump in text! A gap in the language!
Y-yes, that's... Normally, that's true. But this letter just happened to line up.
So, um, if you take the end of page one and the start of page three, it reads, ＂You remind me of...moldy cheese.＂
Oh yes, I remember that quite well. ...But wait. Are you saying that ISN'T what the letter originally said?
But that means the scathing reply I sent...
Oh, I recall THAT one well! Quite shocking, actually, to open a letter from a friend and find a firestorm of invective.
I asked what I'd done to merit such a tirade, but you only replied with still further abuse—and a snide remark about week-old bleu, if I recall.
Erm...
At that point, I was seeing red myself, so I drafted a letter cutting off all ties and threw it in your face.
From that moment on, it was war.
Y-you see? All of this was just a... a misreading of a letter.
So, um, do you think you can reconcile with one another and see it in your hearts to accept Julia and Remuel's love?
Please, Father.
I beg this of you!
Hmm. Even knowing the cause, a man's feelings don't just change in a moment.
Indeed not. We've been at it for so long, and this isn't the sort of divide one can bridge overnight.
No...
Instead, it will take work and dedication— as well as communication between our two families.
...What?
V-very well. If he is willing to accept this... I suppose I am as well.
Oh, thank you, Father! Thank you! Remuel, did you hear that?!
I can scarcely believe it, Julia!
We owe our future to you, Noelle!
Oh! Um, I mean... I didn't really...
I'm just glad that you and Remuel...er, and both of your fathers have managed to reconnect.
(It's hard to get feelings across when you speak—or even when you write a letter.)
(But that's why I'll never stop running... So I can make sure people are connected!)
